html:
As artificial intelligence continues to reshape industries, it redefines the relationship between humans and technology. Nowhere is this transformation more critical than in user experience (UX) design. No longer limited to static interfaces and predictable user flows, today’s digital products must adapt, predict, and learn — just like the people using them. AI + GenAI brings new capabilities; therefore, how do we design experiences that are not just intelligent but also human-centered, ethical, and universal in execution?

(I know another article about AI, but stick with me on this one. Over the past 18 months, I have been giving workshops with Designlab, Optimal Workshop, OCUX, UXPALA, students at the Art Center College of Design, and Otis College of Art and Design, and this article is a collection of insights discovered along the way.)
